   21: -module(process_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %% Tests processes, trapping exit messages and the BIFs:
   24: %% 	exit/1
   25: %%	exit/2
   26: %%	process_info/1,2
   27: %%	register/2 (partially)
   28:

   31:

   33: 
   34: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   35: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, spawn_with_binaries/1,
   36: 	 t_exit_1/1, t_exit_2_other/1, t_exit_2_other_normal/1,

  116: suite() ->
  117:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  118:      {timetrap, {minutes, 9}}].

  120: all() ->
  121:     [spawn_with_binaries, t_exit_1, {group, t_exit_2},
  122:      trap_exit_badarg, trap_exit_badarg_in_bif,
  123:      bump_reductions, low_prio, yield, yield2, otp_4725,
  124:      dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak, bad_register, garbage_collect,
  125:      process_flag_badarg,
  126:      process_flag_fullsweep_after, process_flag_heap_size,
  127:      command_line_max_heap_size,
  128:      spawn_opt_heap_size, spawn_opt_max_heap_size,
  129:      more_spawn_opt_max_heap_size,
  130:      spawn_huge_arglist,
  131:      otp_6237,
  132:      {group, spawn_request},
  133:      {group, process_info_bif},
  134:      {group, processes_bif},
  135:      {group, otp_7738}, garb_other_running,
  136:      {group, system_task},
  137:      {group, alias},
  138:      monitor_tag].
  139: 
  140: groups() -> 
  141:     [{t_exit_2, [],
  142:       [t_exit_2_other, t_exit_2_other_normal, self_exit,
  143:        normal_suicide_exit, abnormal_suicide_exit,
  144:        t_exit_2_catch, exit_and_timeout, exit_twice]},
  145:      {spawn_request, [],
  146:       [spawn_request_bif,
  147:        spawn_request_monitor_demonitor,
  148:        spawn_request_monitor_child_exit,
  149:        spawn_request_link_child_exit,
  150:        spawn_request_link_parent_exit,
  151:        spawn_request_link_parent_exit_compound_reason,
  152:        spawn_request_link_parent_exit_nodedown,
  153:        spawn_request_abandon_bif,

  156:        spawn_against_old_node,
  157:        spawn_against_new_node,

  168:        process_info_other, process_info_other_msg,
  169:        process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race,
  170:        process_info_other_dist_msg, process_info_other_status,
  171:        process_info_2_list,
  172:        process_info_lock_reschedule,
  173:        process_info_lock_reschedule2,
  174:        process_info_lock_reschedule3,

  176:        process_info_parent,

  197: 
  198: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  199:     A0 = case application:start(sasl) of
  200: 	     ok -> [sasl];
  201: 	     _ -> []
  202: 	 end,
  203:     A = case application:start(os_mon) of
  204: 	     ok -> [os_mon|A0];
  205: 	     _ -> A0
  206: 	 end,
  207:     [{started_apps, A}|Config].
  208: 
  209: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  210:     As = proplists:get_value(started_apps, Config),
  211:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> application:stop(A) end, As),
  212:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  213:     Config.
  214: 
  215: init_per_group(alias, Config) ->
  216:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  217:     Config;
  218: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  219:     Config.
  220: 
  221: end_per_group(alias, Config) ->
  222:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  223:     Config;
  224: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  225:     Config.
  226: 
  227: init_per_testcase(Func, Config)
  228:   when Func =:= processes_default_tab;
  229:        Func =:= processes_this_tab ->
  230:     case erlang:system_info(build_type) of
  231:         BT when BT =:= debug; BT =:= valgrind ->
  232:             {skip, "Don't run in debug/valgrind"};
  233:         _ ->
  234:             [{testcase, Func} | Config]
  235:     end;
  236: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  237:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
  238: 
  239: end_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  240:     %% Restore max_heap_size to default value.
  241:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size,
  242:                        #{size => 0,
  243:                          kill => true,
  244:                          error_logger => true}),
  245:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
  246: 
  247: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
  248:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, []]).
  249: 
  250: %% Tests that binaries as arguments to spawn/3 doesn't leak
  251: %% (unclear if this test case will actually prove anything on
  252: %% a modern computer with lots of memory).
  253: spawn_with_binaries(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  254:     L = lists:duplicate(2048, 42),
  255:     TwoMeg = lists:duplicate(1024, L),
  256:     Fun = fun() -> spawn(?MODULE, binary_owner, [list_to_binary(TwoMeg)]),
  257: 			 receive after 1 -> ok end end,
  258:     Iter = case test_server:is_valgrind() of
  259: 		     true -> 10;
  260: 		     false -> 150
  261: 		 end,
  262:     test_server:do_times(Iter, Fun),
  263:     ok.
  264: 
  265: binary_owner(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
  266:     ok.
  267: 
  268: %% Tests exit/1 with a big message.
  269: t_exit_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  270:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  271:     start_spawner(),
  272:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  273:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_1/0),
  274:     stop_spawner(),
  275:     ok.
  276: 
  277: t_exit_1() ->
  278:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(kb_128()) end),
  279:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  280:     receive
  281: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  282: 	  end.
  283: 
  284: 
  285: %% Tests exit/2 with a lot of data in the exit message.
  286: t_exit_2_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  287:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  288:     start_spawner(),
  289:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  290:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_2_other/0),
  291:     stop_spawner(),
  292:     ok.
  293: 
  294: t_exit_2_other() ->
  295:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  296:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  297:     exit(Pid, Garbage),
  298:     receive
  299: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  300: 	  end.
  301: 
  302: %% Tests that exit(Pid, normal) does not kill another process.;
  303: t_exit_2_other_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  304:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  305:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  306:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  307:     exit(Pid, normal),
  308:     receive
  309: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
  310: 		  ct:fail({process_died, Reason})
  311: 	  after 1000 ->
  312: 		  ok
  313: 	  end,
  314:     case process_info(Pid) of
  315: 	      undefined ->
  316: 		  ct:fail(process_died_on_normal);
  317: 	      List when is_list(List) ->
  318: 		  ok
  319: 	  end,
  320:     exit(Pid, kill),
  321:     ok.
  322: 
  323: %% Tests that we can trap an exit message sent with exit/2 from
  324: %% the same process.
  325: self_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  326:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  327:     start_spawner(),
  328:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  329:     test_server:do_times(200, fun self_exit/0),
  330:     stop_spawner(),
  331:     ok.
  332: 
  333: self_exit() ->
  334:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  335:     P = self(),
  336:     true = exit(P, Garbage),
  337:     receive
  338: 	      {'EXIT', P, Garbage} -> ok
  339: 	  end.
  340: 
  341: %% Tests exit(self(), normal) is equivalent to exit(normal) for a process
  342: %% that doesn't trap exits.
  343: normal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  344:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  345:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), normal) end),
  346:     receive
  347: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} -> ok;
  348: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  349: 	  end.
  350: 
  351: %% Tests exit(self(), Term) is equivalent to exit(Term) for a process
  352: %% that doesn't trap exits.";
  353: abnormal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  354:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  355:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  356:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), Garbage) end),
  357:     receive
  358: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok;
  359: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  360: 	  end.
  361: 
  362: %% Tests that exit(self(), die) cannot be caught.
  363: t_exit_2_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  364:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  365:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> catch exit(self(), die) end),
  366:     receive
  367: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  368: 		  ct:fail(catch_worked);
  369: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, die} ->
  370: 		  ok;
  371: 	      Other ->
  372: 		  ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  373: 	  end.
  374: 
  375: %% Tests trapping of an 'EXIT' message generated by a bad argument to
  376: %% the abs/1 bif.  The 'EXIT' message will intentionally be very big.
  377: trap_exit_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  378:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  379:     start_spawner(),
  380:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  381:     try
  382:         %% suppress  =ERROR REPORT=== emulator messages
  383:         ok = logger:add_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam, {
  384:             fun(#{meta := #{error_logger := #{emulator := true, tag := error}}}, _Report) ->
  385:                 stop;
  386:             (_Meta, _Report) ->
  387:                 ignore
  388:             end, ok}),
  389:         test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg/0),
  390:         ct:sleep(500) %% flush logging
  391:     after
  392:         ok = logger:remove_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam)
  393:     end,
  394:     stop_spawner(),
  395:     ok.
  396: 
  397: trap_exit_badarg() ->
  398:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> bad_guy(kb_128()) end),
  399:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  400:     receive
  401: 	      {'EXIT',Pid,{badarg,[{erlang,abs,[Garbage],Loc1},
  402: 				   {?MODULE,bad_guy,1,Loc2}|_]}}
  403: 	      when is_list(Loc1), is_list(Loc2) ->
  404: 		  ok;
  405: 	      Other ->
  406: 		  ok = io:format("Bad EXIT message: ~P", [Other, 30]),
  407: 		  ct:fail(bad_exit_message)
  408: 	  end.
  409: 
  410: bad_guy(Arg) ->
  411:     abs(Arg).
  412: 
  413: 
  414: kb_128() ->
  415:     Eight = eight_kb(),
  416:     {big_binary(),
  417:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  418:      big_binary(),
  419:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  420:      big_binary()}.
  421: 
  422: eight_kb() ->
  423:     B64 = lists:seq(1, 64),
  424:     B512 = {<<1>>,B64,<<2,3>>,B64,make_unaligned_sub_binary(<<4,5,6,7,8,9>>),
  425: 		  B64,make_sub_binary([1,2,3,4,5,6]),
  426: 		  B64,make_sub_binary(lists:seq(1, ?heap_binary_size+1)),
  427: 		  B64,B64,B64,B64,big_binary()},
  428:     lists:duplicate(8, {B512,B512}).
  429: 
  430: big_binary() ->
  431:     big_binary(10, [42]).
  432: big_binary(0, Acc) ->
  433:     list_to_binary(Acc);
  434: big_binary(N, Acc) ->
  435:     big_binary(N-1, [Acc|Acc]).
  436: 
  437: %% Test receiving an EXIT message when spawning a BIF with bad arguments.
  438: trap_exit_badarg_in_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  439:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  440:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  441:     test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg_bif/0),
  442:     ok.
  443:     
  444: trap_exit_badarg_bif() ->
  445:     Pid = spawn_link(erlang, node, [1]),
  446:     receive
  447: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, {badarg, _}} ->
  448: 		  ok;
  449: 	      Other ->
  450: 		  ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  451: 	  end.
  452: 
  453: %% The following sequences of events have crasched Beam.
  454: %%
  455: %% 1) An exit is sent to a process which is currently not running.
  456: %%    The exit reason will (on purpose) overwrite the message queue
  457: %%    pointer.
  458: %% 2) Before the process is scheduled in, it receives a timeout (from
  459: %%    a 'receive after').
  460: %% 3) The process will crash the next time it executes 'receive'.
  461: 
  462: exit_and_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  463:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  464: 
  465:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  466:     Parent = self(),
  467:     Low = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_low(Parent) end),
  468:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_high(Low) end),
  469:     eat_wait_for(Low, High),
  470:     ok.
  471: 
  472: 
  473: eat_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  474:     receive
  475: 	{'EXIT', Low, {you, are, dead}} ->
  476: 	    ok;
  477: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  478: 	    eat_wait_for(Low, High);
  479: 	Other ->
  480: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  481:     end.
  482: 
  483: eat_low(_Parent) ->
  484:     receive
  485:     after 2500 ->
  486: 	    ok
  487:     end,
  488:     receive
  489: 	Any ->
  490: 	    io:format("Received: ~p\n", [Any])
  491:     after 1000 ->
  492: 	    ok
  493:     end.
  494:     
  495: eat_high(Low) ->
  496:     process_flag(priority, high),
  497:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  498:     exit(Low, {you, are, dead}),
  499:     loop(erlang:monotonic_time() + erlang:convert_time_unit(5,second,native)).
  500: 
  501: %% Busy loop for 5 seconds.
  502: 
  503: loop(StopTime) ->
  504:     case StopTime >= erlang:monotonic_time() of
  505: 	true -> ok;
  506: 	false -> loop(StopTime)
  507:     end.
  508: 
  509: 
  510: %% Tries to send two different exit messages to a process.
  511: %% (The second one should be ignored.)
  512: exit_twice(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  513:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  514: 
  515:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  516:     Low = fun_spawn(fun etwice_low/0),
  517:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> etwice_high(Low) end),
  518:     etwice_wait_for(Low, High),
  519:     ok.
  520: 
  521: etwice_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  522:     receive
  523: 	{'EXIT', Low, first} ->
  524: 	    ok;
  525: 	{'EXIT', Low, Other} ->
  526: 	    ct:fail({wrong_exit_reason, Other});
  527: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  528: 	    etwice_wait_for(Low, High);
  529: 	Other ->
  530: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  531:     end.
  532: 
  533: etwice_low() ->
  534:     etwice_low().
  535: 
  536: etwice_high(Low) ->
  537:     process_flag(priority, high),
  538:     exit(Low, first),
  539:     exit(Low, second).
  540: 
  541: %% Tests the process_info/2 BIF.
  542: t_process_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  543:     [] = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  544:     register(my_name, self()),
  545:     {registered_name, my_name} = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  546:     {status, running} = process_info(self(), status),
  547:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
  548:     {min_bin_vheap_size,46422} = process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
  549:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true}} =
  550:         process_info(self(), max_heap_size),
  551:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  552: 	process_info(self(), current_function),
  553:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  554: 	apply(erlang, process_info, [self(),current_function]),
  555: 
  556:     %% current_location and current_stacktrace
  557:     {Line1,Res1} = {?LINE,process_info(self(), current_location)},
  558:     verify_loc(Line1, Res1),
  559:     {Line2,Res2} = {?LINE,apply(erlang, process_info,
  560: 				[self(),current_location])},
  561:     verify_loc(Line2, Res2),
  562:     pi_stacktrace([{?MODULE,t_process_info,1,?LINE}]),
  563: 
  564:     verify_stacktrace_depth(),
  565: 
  566:     Gleader = group_leader(),
  567:     {group_leader, Gleader} = process_info(self(), group_leader),
  568:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_Info}} = (catch process_info('not_a_pid')),
  569:     ok.
  570: 
  571: verify_stacktrace_depth() ->
  572:     CS = current_stacktrace,
  573:     OldDepth = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 0),
  574:     {CS,[]} = erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  575:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 8),
  576:     {CS,[{?MODULE,verify_stacktrace_depth,0,_},_|_]} =
  577:         erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  578:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, OldDepth).
  579: 
  580: pi_stacktrace(Expected0) ->
  581:     {Line,Res} = {?LINE,erlang:process_info(self(), current_stacktrace)},
  582:     {current_stacktrace,Stack} = Res,
  583:     Expected = [{?MODULE,pi_stacktrace,1,Line}|Expected0],
  584:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stack, Expected).
  585: 
  586: pi_stacktrace_1([{M,F,A,Loc}|Stk], [{M,F,A,Line}|Exp]) ->
  587:     case Loc of
  588: 	[] ->
  589: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  590: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  591: 		      [M,F,A]),
  592: 	    ok;
  593: 	[_|_] ->
  594: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  595: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  596: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  597:     end,
  598:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stk, Exp);
  599: pi_stacktrace_1([_|_], []) -> ok.
  600: 
  601: verify_loc(Line, {current_location,{?MODULE,t_process_info=F,1=A,Loc}}) ->
  602:     case Loc of
  603: 	[] ->
  604: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  605: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  606: 		      [?MODULE,F,A]),
  607: 	    ok;
  608: 	[_|_] ->
  609: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  610: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  611: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  612:     end.
  613: 
  614: process_info_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  615:     Self = self(),
  616:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> process_info_looper(Self) end),
  617:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  618:     pio_current_location(10000, Pid, 0, 0),
  619:     pio_current_stacktrace().
  620: 
  621: pio_current_location(0, _, Pi, Looper) ->
  622:     io:format("~w call(s) to erlang:process_info/2", [Pi]),
  623:     io:format("~w call(s) to ~w:process_info_looper/1", [Looper,?MODULE]);
  624: pio_current_location(N, Pid, Pi, Looper) ->
  625:     erlang:yield(),
  626:     {current_location,Where} = process_info(Pid, current_location),
  627:     case Where of
  628: 	{erlang,process_info,2,[]} ->
  629: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  630: 	{erts_internal,await_result,1, Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  631: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  632: 	{?MODULE,process_info_looper,1,Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  633: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi, Looper+1);
  634: 	_ ->
  635: 	    exit({unexpected_location, Where})
  636:     end.
  637: 
  638: pio_current_stacktrace() ->
  639:     L = [begin
  640: 	     case process_info(P, current_stacktrace) of
  641:                  {current_stacktrace, Stk} -> {P,Stk};
  642:                  undefined -> {P, []}
  643:              end
  644: 	 end || P <- processes()],
  645:     [erlang:garbage_collect(P) || {P,_} <- L],
  646:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  647:     [verify_stacktrace(Stk) || {_,Stk} <- L],
  648:     ok.
  649: 
  650: verify_stacktrace([{M,F,A,Loc}|T])
  651:   when is_atom(M),
  652:        is_atom(F),
  653:        is_integer(A),
  654:        is_list(Loc) ->
  655:     verify_stacktrace(T);
  656: verify_stacktrace([]) -> ok.
  657: 
  658: process_info_looper(Parent) ->
  659:     process_info(Parent, current_location),
  660:     process_info_looper(Parent).
  661: 
  662: %% Tests the process_info/1 BIF on another process with messages.
  663: process_info_other_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  664:     Self = self(),
  665:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  666:     receive
  667: 	{go_ahead,Pid} -> ok
  668:     end,
  669: 
  670:     Own = {my,own,message},
  671: 
  672:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  673:     
  674:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  675:     MsgA = {a,Garbage},
  676:     MsgB = {b,Garbage},
  677:     MsgC = {c,Garbage},
  678:     MsgD = {d,Garbage},
  679:     MsgE = {e,Garbage},
  680: 
  681:     Pid ! MsgA,
  682:     {messages,[Own,MsgA]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  683:     Pid ! MsgB,
  684:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  685:     Pid ! MsgC,
  686:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  687:     Pid ! MsgD,
  688:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  689:     Pid ! MsgE,
  690:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  691:     {memory,BytesOther} = process_info(Pid, memory),
  692:     {memory,BytesSelf} = process_info(self(), memory),
  693: 
  694:     io:format("Memory ~p: ~p\n", [Pid,BytesOther]),
  695:     io:format("Memory ~p (self): ~p\n", [self(),BytesSelf]),
  696: 
  697:     [Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE] = All,
  698: 
  699:     Pid ! {self(),empty},
  700:     receive
  701: 	      empty -> ok
  702: 	  end,
  703:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  704: 
  705:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
  706:     {min_bin_vheap_size, 46422} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
  707:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true}} =
  708:         process_info(self(), max_heap_size),
  709: 
  710:     Pid ! stop,
  711:     ok.
  712: 
  713: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  714:     %% OTP-18169
  715:     %%
  716:     %% The race window triggering this bug is quite small. This test
  717:     %% wont fail even with the bug present, but it may trigger an
  718:     %% assertion in the debug compiled emulator if the bug is
  719:     %% present...
  720:     process_flag(priority, high),
  721:     SSchdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  722:                   1 -> 1;
  723:                   _ -> 2
  724:               end,
  725:     Flush = fun Flush () ->
  726:                     receive _ -> Flush()
  727:                     after 0 -> ok
  728:                     end
  729:             end,
  730:     RFun = fun RFun () ->
  731:                    receive
  732:                        {flush, From} ->
  733:                            Flush(),
  734:                            From ! flushed
  735:                    end,
  736:                    RFun()
  737:            end,
  738:     R = spawn_opt(RFun, [link,
  739:                          {scheduler, 1},
  740:                          {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  741:     SFun = fun SFun () ->
  742:                    receive go -> ok end,
  743:                    M = erlang:monitor(process, R),
  744:                    R ! hi,
  745:                    receive
  746:                        {demonitor, From} ->
  747:                            _ = erlang:demonitor(M),
  748:                            From ! demonitored
  749:                    end,
  750:                    SFun()
  751:            end,
  752:     S = spawn_opt(SFun, [link,
  753:                          {scheduler, SSchdlr},
  754:                          {priority, high}]),
  755:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(10000, S, R),
  756:     unlink(R),
  757:     exit(R, kill),
  758:     unlink(S),
  759:     exit(S, kill),
  760:     false = is_process_alive(R),
  761:     false = is_process_alive(S),
  762:     ok.
  763: 
  764: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(0, _S, _R) ->
  765:     ok;
  766: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N, S, R) ->
  767:     S ! go,
  768:     erlang:yield(),
  769:     _ = process_info(R, message_queue_len),
  770:     S ! {demonitor, self()},
  771:     receive demonitored -> ok end,
  772:     R ! {flush, self()},
  773:     receive flushed -> ok end,
  774:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N-1, S, R).
  775: 
  776: process_info_other_dist_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  777:     %%
  778:     %% Check that process_info can handle messages that have not been
  779:     %% decoded yet.
  780:     %%
  781:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  782:     Self = self(),
  783:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  784:     receive {go_ahead,Pid} -> ok end,
  785: 
  786:     Own = {my,own,message},
  787: 
  788:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  789:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  790:     MsgA = {a,self(),Garbage},
  791:     MsgB = {b,self(),Garbage},
  792:     MsgC = {c,self(),Garbage},
  793:     MsgD = {d,self(),Garbage},
  794:     MsgE = {e,self(),Garbage},
  795: 
  796:     %% We don't want the other process to decode messages itself
  797:     %% therefore we suspend it.
  798:     true =  erlang:suspend_process(Pid),
  799:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  800: 		Pid  ! MsgA,
  801: 		Pid  ! MsgB,
  802: 		Pid  ! MsgC,
  803: 		Self ! check_abc
  804: 	end),
  805:     receive check_abc -> ok end,
  806:     [{status,suspended},
  807: 	{messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]},
  808: 	{status,suspended}]= process_info(Pid, [status,messages,status]),
  809:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  810: 		Pid  ! MsgD,
  811: 		Pid  ! MsgE,
  812: 		Self ! check_de
  813: 	end),
  814:     receive check_de -> ok end,
  815:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  816:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid),
  817:     Pid ! {self(), get_all_messages},
  818:     receive
  819: 	      {all_messages, AllMsgs} ->
  820: 		  All = AllMsgs
  821: 	  end,
  822:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  823:     Pid ! stop,
  824:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  825:     ok.
  826: 
  827: process_info_other_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  828:     %% OTP-17628: status was erroneously reported as 'running',
  829:     %% when it should be 'waiting', when the priority of the
  830:     %% caller exceeded the priority of the processes being
  831:     %% checked (due to prio elevation).
  832:     Self = self(),
  833:     Other = spawn_link(fun () -> other_process(Self) end),
  834:     receive {go_ahead, Other} -> ok end,
  835:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  836:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  837:     process_flag(priority, high),
  838:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  839:     process_flag(priority, max),
  840:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  841:     Other ! stop,
  842:     ok.
  843: 
  844: other_process(Parent) ->
  845:     self() ! {my,own,message},
  846:     Parent ! {go_ahead,self()},
  847:     other_process_1().
  848: 
  849: other_process_1() ->
  850:     receive
  851: 	{Parent,get_all_messages} ->
  852: 	    Parent ! {all_messages, get_all_messages()},
  853: 	    other_process_1();
  854: 	{Parent,empty} ->
  855: 	    receive_all(),
  856: 	    Parent ! empty,
  857: 	    other_process_1();
  858: 	stop -> ok
  859:     end.
  860: 
  861: get_all_messages() ->
  862:     get_all_messages([]).
  863: 
  864: get_all_messages(Msgs) ->
  865:     receive
  866: 	Msg ->
  867: 	    get_all_messages([Msg|Msgs])
  868:     after 0 ->
  869: 	    lists:reverse(Msgs)
  870:     end.
  871: 
  872: receive_all() ->
  873:     receive
  874: 	_ -> receive_all()
  875:     after 0 -> ok
  876:     end.
  877: 
  878: chk_pi_order([],[]) ->
  879:     ok;
  880: chk_pi_order([{Arg, _}| Values], [Arg|Args]) ->
  881:     chk_pi_order(Values, Args).
  882: 
  883: process_info_2_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  884:     Proc = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  885:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list1, self()),
  886:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list2, Proc),
  887:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state,true),
  888:     AllArgs = erts_debug:get_internal_state(process_info_args),
  889:     A1 = lists:sort(AllArgs) ++ [status] ++ lists:reverse(AllArgs),
  890: 
  891:     %% Verify that argument is accepted as single atom
  892:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
  893: 		{A, _} = process_info(Proc, A),
  894: 		{A, _} = process_info(self(), A)
  895: 	end, A1),
  896: 
  897:     %% Verify that order is preserved
  898:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(self(), A1), A1),
  899:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(Proc, A1), A1),
  900: 
  901:     %% Small arg list
  902:     A2 = [status, stack_size, trap_exit, priority],
  903:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  904: 	= process_info(Proc, A2),
  905:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  906: 	= process_info(self(), A2),
  907: 
  908:     %% Huge arg list (note values are shared)
  909:     A3 = lists:duplicate(5000,backtrace),
  910:     V3 = process_info(Proc, A3),
  911:     5000 = length(V3),
  912:     lists:foreach(fun ({backtrace, _}) -> ok end, V3),
  913:     ok.
  914:     
  915: process_info_lock_reschedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  916:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
  917:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
  918:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
  919:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
  920:     register(Name1, Target1),
  921:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  922:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
  923:     register(Name2, Target2),
  924:     PI = fun(_) ->
  925: 	    erlang:yield(),
  926: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}] = process_info(Target1, [registered_name]),
  927: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}] = process_info(Target2, [registered_name]),
  928: 	    erlang:yield(),
  929: 	    {registered_name, Name1} = process_info(Target1, registered_name),
  930: 	    {registered_name, Name2} = process_info(Target2, registered_name),
  931: 	    erlang:yield(),
  932: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}| _] = process_info(Target1),
  933: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}| _] = process_info(Target2)
  934:     end,
  935:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000)),
  936:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
  937:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
  938: 	{status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
  939: 				OkStatus == running;
  940: 				OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
  941: 	    unlink(Target1),
  942: 	    unlink(Target2),
  943: 	    exit(Target1, bang),
  944: 	    exit(Target2, bang),
  945: 	    OkStatus;
  946: 	{status, BadStatus} ->
  947: 	    ct:fail(BadStatus)
  948:     end.
  949: 
  950: pi_loop(_Name, _Pid, 0) ->
  951:     ok;
  952: pi_loop(Name, Pid, N) ->
  953:     {registered_name, Name} = process_info(Pid, registered_name),
  954:     pi_loop(Name, Pid, N-1).
  955: 
  956: process_info_lock_reschedule2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  957:     Parent = self(),
  958:     Fun = fun () ->
  959: 	    receive {go, Name, Pid} -> ok end,
  960: 	    pi_loop(Name, Pid, 10000),
  961: 	    Parent ! {done, self()},
  962: 	    receive after infinity -> ok end
  963:     end,
  964:     P1 = spawn_link(Fun),
  965:     N1 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_1,
  966:     true = register(N1, P1),
  967:     P2 = spawn_link(Fun),
  968:     N2 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_2,
  969:     true = register(N2, P2),
  970:     P3 = spawn_link(Fun),
  971:     N3 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_3,
  972:     true = register(N3, P3),
  973:     P4 = spawn_link(Fun),
  974:     N4 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_4,
  975:     true = register(N4, P4),
  976:     P5 = spawn_link(Fun),
  977:     N5 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_5,
  978:     true = register(N5, P5),
  979:     P6 = spawn_link(Fun),
  980:     N6 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_6,
  981:     true = register(N6, P6),
  982:     P1 ! {go, N2, P2},
  983:     P2 ! {go, N1, P1},
  984:     P3 ! {go, N1, P1},
  985:     P4 ! {go, N1, P1},
  986:     P5 ! {go, N6, P6},
  987:     P6 ! {go, N5, P5},
  988:     receive {done, P1} -> ok end,
  989:     receive {done, P2} -> ok end,
  990:     receive {done, P3} -> ok end,
  991:     receive {done, P4} -> ok end,
  992:     receive {done, P5} -> ok end,
  993:     receive {done, P6} -> ok end,
  994:     unlink(P1), exit(P1, bang),
  995:     unlink(P2), exit(P2, bang),
  996:     unlink(P3), exit(P3, bang),
  997:     unlink(P4), exit(P4, bang),
  998:     unlink(P5), exit(P5, bang),
  999:     unlink(P6), exit(P6, bang),
 1000:     ok.
 1001: 
 1002: many_args(0,_B,_C,_D,_E,_F,_G,_H,_I,_J) ->
 1003:     ok;
 1004: many_args(A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J) ->
 1005:     many_args(A-1,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J).
 1006: 
 1007: do_pi_msg_len(PT, AT) ->
 1008:     lists:map(fun (_) -> ok end, [a,b,c,d]),
 1009:     {message_queue_len, _} = process_info(element(2,PT), element(2,AT)).
 1010:     
 1011: process_info_lock_reschedule3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1012:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
 1013:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
 1014:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
 1015:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
 1016:     register(Name1, Target1),
 1017:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 1018:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
 1019:     register(Name2, Target2),
 1020:     PI = fun(N) ->
 1021: 	    case N rem 10 of
 1022: 		0 -> erlang:yield();
 1023: 		_ -> ok
 1024: 	    end,
 1025: 	    do_pi_msg_len({proc, Target1},
 1026: 		{arg, message_queue_len})
 1027:     end,
 1028:     many_args(100000,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9),
 1029:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000000)),
 1030:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
 1031:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
 1032: 	      {status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
 1033: 				      OkStatus == running;
 1034: 				      OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
 1035: 		  unlink(Target1),
 1036: 		  unlink(Target2),
 1037: 		  exit(Target1, bang),
 1038: 		  exit(Target2, bang),
 1039: 		  OkStatus;
 1040: 	      {status, BadStatus} ->
 1041: 		  ct:fail(BadStatus)
 1042: 	  end.
 1043: 
 1044: otp_4725(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1045:     Tester = self(),
 1046:     Ref1 = make_ref(),
 1047:     Pid1 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1048: 		Tester ! {Ref1, process_info(self())},
 1049: 		receive
 1050: 		    Ref1 -> bye
 1051: 		end
 1052: 	end, [link, {priority, max}, {fullsweep_after, 600}]),
 1053:     receive
 1054: 	{Ref1, ProcInfo1A} ->
 1055: 	    ProcInfo1B = process_info(Pid1),
 1056: 	    Pid1 ! Ref1,
 1057: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo1A, ProcInfo1B)
 1058:     end,
 1059:     Ref2 = make_ref(),
 1060:     Pid2 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1061: 		Tester ! {Ref2, process_info(self())},
 1062: 		receive
 1063: 		    Ref2 -> bye
 1064: 		end
 1065: 	end,
 1066: 	[]),
 1067:     receive
 1068: 	{Ref2, ProcInfo2A} ->
 1069: 	    ProcInfo2B = process_info(Pid2),
 1070: 	    Pid2 ! Ref2,
 1071: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo2A, ProcInfo2B)
 1072:     end,
 1073:     ok.
 1074: 
 1075: check_proc_infos(A, B) ->
 1076:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, A),
 1077:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, B),
 1078: 
 1079:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, A),
 1080:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, B),
 1081: 
 1082:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, A),
 1083:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, B),
 1084: 
 1085:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, A),
 1086:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, B),
 1087: 
 1088:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, A),
 1089:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, B),
 1090: 
 1091:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, A),
 1092:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, B),
 1093: 
 1094:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, A),
 1095:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, B),
 1096: 
 1097:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, A),
 1098:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, B),
 1099: 
 1100:     ok.
 1101:
