 1105: start_spawner() ->
 1106:     ok.
 1107: 
 1108: stop_spawner() ->
 1109:     ok.
 1110: 
 1111: %% Tests erlang:process_info(Pid, garbage_collection_info)
 1112: process_info_garbage_collection(_Config) ->
 1113:     Parent = self(),
 1114:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1115:             fun() ->
 1116:                     %% We set mqd to off_heap and send an tuple
 1117:                     %% to process in order to force mbuf_size
 1118:                     %% to be used
 1119:                     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
 1120:                     receive go -> ok end,
 1121:                     (fun F(0) ->
 1122:                              Parent ! deep,
 1123:                              receive {ok,_} -> ok end,
 1124:                              [];
 1125:                          F(N) ->
 1126:                              timer:sleep(1),
 1127:                              [lists:seq(1,100) | F(N-1)]
 1128:                      end)(1000),
 1129:                     Parent ! shallow,
 1130:                     receive done -> ok end
 1131:             end),
 1132:     [{garbage_collection_info, Before},{total_heap_size, THSBefore}] =
 1133:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1134:     Pid ! go, receive deep -> ok end,
 1135:     [{_, Deep},{_,THSDeep}]  =
 1136:          erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1137:     Pid ! {ok, make_ref()}, receive shallow -> ok end,
 1138:     [{_, After},{_, THSAfter}] =
 1139:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1140:     Pid ! done,
 1141: 
 1142:     %% Do some general checks to see if everything seems to be roughly correct
 1143:     ct:log("Before: ~p",[Before]),
 1144:     ct:log("Deep: ~p",[Deep]),
 1145:     ct:log("After: ~p",[After]),
 1146:     ct:log("Before THS: ~p",[THSBefore]),
 1147:     ct:log("Deep THS: ~p",[THSDeep]),
 1148:     ct:log("After THS: ~p",[THSAfter]),
 1149: 
 1150:     %% Check stack_size
 1151:     true = gv(stack_size, Before) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1152:     true = gv(stack_size, After) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1153: 
 1154:     %% Check used heap size
 1155:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1156:         < gv(heap_size, Deep) + gv(old_heap_size, Deep),
 1157:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1158:         < gv(heap_size, After) + gv(old_heap_size, After),
 1159: 
 1160:     %% Check that total_heap_size == heap_block_size + old_heap_block_size + mbuf_size
 1161:     THSBefore = gv(heap_block_size, Before)
 1162:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Before)
 1163:         + gv(mbuf_size, Before),
 1164: 
 1165:     THSDeep = gv(heap_block_size, Deep)
 1166:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Deep)
 1167:         + gv(mbuf_size, Deep),
 1168: 
 1169:     THSAfter = gv(heap_block_size, After)
 1170:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, After)
 1171:         + gv(mbuf_size, After),
 1172: 
 1173:     ok.
 1174: 
 1175: gv(Key,List) ->
 1176:     proplists:get_value(Key,List).
 1177: 
 1178: process_info_parent(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1179:     Child = spawn_link(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end),
 1180:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()}, erlang:process_info(Child, parent)),
 1181:     Child ! stop,
 1182:     ?assertEqual({parent, undefined}, erlang:process_info(whereis(init), parent)),
 1183: 
 1184:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1185:     RemoteChild = spawn_link(Node,
 1186:                              fun () ->
 1187:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1188:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1189:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1190:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1191:                                      Parent ! remote_child_hello,
 1192:                                      receive stop -> ok end
 1193:                              end),
 1194:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()},
 1195:                  erpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [RemoteChild, parent])),
 1196:     receive remote_child_hello -> ok end,
 1197:     unlink(RemoteChild),
 1198:     RemoteChild ! stop,
 1199:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1200:     ok.
 1201: 
 1202: process_info_smoke_all_tester() ->
 1203:     register(process_info_smoke_all_tester, self()),
 1204:     put(ets_ref, ets:new(blupp, [])),
 1205:     put(binary, [list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 1)),
 1206:                  list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 2))]),
 1207:     process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop().
 1208: 
 1209: process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop() ->
 1210:     receive
 1211:         {other_process, Pid} ->
 1212:             case get(procs) of
 1213:                 undefined -> put(procs, [Pid]);
 1214:                 Procs -> put(procs, [Pid|Procs])
 1215:             end,
 1216:             erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1217:             link(Pid),
 1218:             process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop()
 1219:     end.
 1220: 
 1221: process_info_smoke_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1222:     AllPIOptions = [registered_name,
 1223:                     current_function,
 1224:                     initial_call,
 1225:                     messages,
 1226:                     message_queue_len,
 1227:                     links,
 1228:                     monitors,
 1229:                     monitored_by,
 1230:                     dictionary,
 1231:                     trap_exit,
 1232:                     error_handler,
 1233:                     heap_size,
 1234:                     stack_size,
 1235:                     memory,
 1236:                     garbage_collection,
 1237:                     group_leader,
 1238:                     reductions,
 1239:                     priority,
 1240:                     trace,
 1241:                     binary,
 1242:                     sequential_trace_token,
 1243:                     catchlevel,
 1244:                     backtrace,
 1245:                     last_calls,
 1246:                     total_heap_size,
 1247:                     suspending,
 1248:                     min_heap_size,
 1249:                     min_bin_vheap_size,
 1250:                     max_heap_size,
 1251:                     current_location,
 1252:                     current_stacktrace,
 1253:                     message_queue_data,
 1254:                     garbage_collection_info,
 1255:                     magic_ref,
 1256:                     fullsweep_after],
 1257: 
 1258:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1259:     RP = spawn_link(Node, fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1260:     LP = spawn_link(fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1261:     RP ! {other_process, LP},
 1262:     LP ! {other_process, RP},
 1263:     LP ! {other_process, self()},
 1264:     LP ! ets:new(blapp, []),
 1265:     LP ! ets:new(blipp, []),
 1266:     LP ! list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 3)),
 1267:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1268:     _MLP = erlang:monitor(process, LP),
 1269:     true = is_process_alive(LP),
 1270:     PI = process_info(LP, AllPIOptions),
 1271:     io:format("~p~n", [PI]),
 1272:     garbage_collect(),
 1273:     unlink(RP),
 1274:     unlink(LP),
 1275:     exit(RP, kill),
 1276:     exit(LP, kill),
 1277:     false = is_process_alive(LP),
 1278:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1279:     ok.
 1280: 
 1281: process_info_status_handled_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1282:     P = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1283:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1284:                    end),
 1285:     wait_until(fun () ->
 1286:                        process_info(P, status) == {status, waiting}
 1287:                end),
 1288:     %%
 1289:     %% The 'messages' option will force a process-info-request
 1290:     %% signal to be scheduled on the process. Ensure that status
 1291:     %% 'waiting' is reported even though it is actually running
 1292:     %% when handling the request. We want it to report the status
 1293:     %% it would have had if it had not been handling the
 1294:     %% process-info-request...
 1295:     %%
 1296:     [{status, waiting}, {messages, []}] = process_info(P, [status, messages]),
 1297:     unlink(P),
 1298:     exit(P, kill),
 1299:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1300:     ok.
 1301: 
 1302: %% OTP-15709
 1303: %% Provoke a bug where process_info(reductions) returned wrong result
 1304: %% because REDS_IN (def_arg_reg[5]) is read when the process in not running.
 1305: %%
 1306: %% And a bug where process_info(reductions) on a process which was releasing its
 1307: %% main lock during execution could result in negative reduction diffs.
 1308: process_info_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1309:     {S1, S2} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1310:                    1 -> {1,1};
 1311:                    _ -> {1,2}
 1312:                end,
 1313:     io:format("Run on schedulers ~p and ~p\n", [S1,S2]),
 1314:     Boss = self(),
 1315:     Doer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1316:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_spinnloop/0, S2),
 1317:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_recvloop/0, S2),
 1318:                              pi_reductions_tester(false, 100, fun pi_reductions_main_unlocker/0, S2),
 1319:                              Boss ! {self(), done}
 1320:                      end,
 1321:                      [link, {scheduler, S1}]),
 1322: 
 1323:     {Doer, done} = receive M -> M end,
 1324:     ok.
 1325: 
 1326: pi_reductions_tester(ForceSignal, MaxCalls, Fun, S2) ->
 1327:     Pid = spawn_opt(Fun, [link, {scheduler,S2}]),
 1328:     Extra = case ForceSignal of
 1329:                 true ->
 1330:                     %% Add another item that force sending the request
 1331:                     %% as a signal, like 'current_function'.
 1332:                     [current_function];
 1333:                 false ->
 1334:                     []
 1335:             end,
 1336:     LoopFun = fun Me(Calls, Prev, Acc0) ->
 1337:                       PI = process_info(Pid, [reductions | Extra]),
 1338:                       [{reductions,Reds} | _] = PI,
 1339:                       Diff = Reds - Prev,
 1340:                       %% Verify we get sane non-negative reduction diffs
 1341:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff >= 0)},
 1342:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff =< 1000*1000)},
 1343:                       Acc1 = [Diff | Acc0],
 1344:                       case Calls >= MaxCalls of
 1345:                           true -> Acc1;
 1346:                           false -> Me(Calls+1, Reds, Acc1)
 1347:                       end
 1348:               end,
 1349:     DiffList = LoopFun(0, 0, []),
 1350:     unlink(Pid),
 1351:     exit(Pid,kill),
 1352:     io:format("Reduction diffs: ~p\n", [lists:reverse(DiffList)]),
 1353:     ok.
 1354: 
 1355: pi_reductions_spinnloop() ->
 1356:     %% 6 args to make use of def_arg_reg[5] which is also used as REDS_IN
 1357:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(999*1000, atom, "hej", self(), make_ref(), 3.14).
 1358: 
 1359: pi_reductions_spinnloop(N,A,B,C,D,E) when N > 0 ->
 1360:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(N-1,B,C,D,E,A);
 1361: pi_reductions_spinnloop(0,_,_,_,_,_) ->
 1362:     %% Stop to limit max number of reductions consumed
 1363:     pi_reductions_recvloop().
 1364: 
 1365: pi_reductions_recvloop() ->
 1366:     receive
 1367:         "a free lunch" -> false
 1368:     end.
 1369: 
 1370: pi_reductions_main_unlocker() ->
 1371:     Other = spawn_link(fun() -> receive die -> ok end end),
 1372:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1373: 
 1374: pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other) ->
 1375:     %% Assumption: register(OtherPid, Name) will unlock main lock of calling
 1376:     %% process during execution.
 1377:     register(pi_reductions_main_unlocker, Other),
 1378:     unregister(pi_reductions_main_unlocker),
 1379: 
 1380:     %% Yield in order to increase probability of process_info sometimes probing
 1381:     %% this process when it's not RUNNING.
 1382:     erlang:yield(),
 1383:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1384: 
 1385: process_info_self_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1386:     %% Test that signals that we have sent to ourselves are
 1387:     %% visible in process_info() result. This is not strictly
 1388:     %% a necessary property, but implemented so now. See
 1389:     %% process_info.c:process_info_bif() for more info.
 1390:     Self = self(),
 1391:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1392:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1393:                              process_info_self_signal_spammer(Self)
 1394:                      end,
 1395:                      fun () ->
 1396:                              self() ! Ref,
 1397:                              process_info(self(), messages)
 1398:                      end,
 1399:                      fun (Res) ->
 1400:                              {messages, [Ref]} = Res
 1401:                      end).
 1402: 
 1403: process_info_self_signal_spammer(To) ->
 1404:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1405:     process_info_self_signal_spammer(To).
 1406: 
 1407: process_info_self_msgq_len(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1408:     %% Spam ourselves with signals forcing us to flush own
 1409:     %% signal queue..
 1410:     Self = self(),
 1411:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1412:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1413:                      end,
 1414:                      fun () ->
 1415:                              process_info(self(), message_queue_len)
 1416:                      end,
 1417:                      fun (Res) ->
 1418:                              {message_queue_len, Len} = Res,
 1419:                              true = Len > 0,
 1420:                              ok
 1421:                      end).
 1422: 
 1423: 
 1424: process_info_self_msgq_len_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1425:     %% Spam ourselves with signals normally forcing us to flush own
 1426:     %% signal queue, but since we also want messages wont be flushed...
 1427:     Self = self(),
 1428:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1429:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self, 100000)
 1430:                      end,
 1431:                      fun () ->
 1432:                              process_info(self(),
 1433:                                           [message_queue_len,
 1434:                                            messages])
 1435:                      end,
 1436:                      fun (Res) ->
 1437:                              [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1438:                               {messages, Msgs}] = Res,
 1439:                              Len = length(Msgs),
 1440:                              ok
 1441:                      end).
 1442: 
 1443: process_info_self_msgq_len_more(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1444:     self() ! hej,
 1445:     BodyRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body(),
 1446:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(BodyRes),
 1447:     TailRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail(),
 1448:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(TailRes),
 1449:     receive hej -> ok end,
 1450:     %% Check that current_function, current_location, and
 1451:     %% current_stacktrace give sane results flushing or not...
 1452:     Self = self(),
 1453:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1454:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1455:                      end,
 1456:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body/0,
 1457:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result/1),
 1458:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1459:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1460:                      end,
 1461:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail/0,
 1462:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result/1).
 1463: 
 1464: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body() ->
 1465:     Res = process_info(self(),
 1466:                        [message_queue_len,
 1467:                         current_function,
 1468:                         current_location,
 1469:                         current_stacktrace]),
 1470:     id(Res).
 1471: 
 1472: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(Res) ->
 1473:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1474:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0}},
 1475:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_}},
 1476:      {current_stacktrace,
 1477:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1478:     true = Len > 0,
 1479:     ok.
 1480: 
 1481: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail() ->
 1482:     process_info(self(),
 1483:                  [message_queue_len,
 1484:                   current_function,
 1485:                   current_location,
 1486:                   current_stacktrace]).
 1487: 
 1488: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(Res) ->
 1489:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1490:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0}},
 1491:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_}},
 1492:      {current_stacktrace,
 1493:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1494:     true = Len > 0,
 1495:     ok.
 1496:     
 1497: 
 1498: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To) ->
 1499:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, 10000000).
 1500: 
 1501: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(_To, 0) ->
 1502:     ok;
 1503: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N) ->
 1504:     To ! hejhopp,
 1505:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1506:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N-1).
 1507: 
 1508: pi_sig_spam_test(SpamFun, PITest, PICheckRes) ->
 1509:     SO = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
 1510:     try
 1511:         Self = self(),
 1512:         SigSpammer = spawn_link(SpamFun),
 1513:         process_flag(priority, low),
 1514:         receive after 10 -> ok end,
 1515:         Res = PITest(),
 1516:         process_flag(priority, high),
 1517:         unlink(SigSpammer),
 1518:         exit(SigSpammer, kill),
 1519:         false = is_process_alive(SigSpammer),
 1520:         PICheckRes(Res)
 1521:     after
 1522:         _ = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SO)
 1523:     end.
 1524: 
 1525: process_info_msgq_len_no_very_long_delay(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1526:     Tester = self(),
 1527:     P1 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1528:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1529:                     end),
 1530:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1531:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1532:     P2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1533:                             Tester ! hello,
 1534:                             P1 ! hello,
 1535:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1536:                     end),
 1537:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1538:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1539:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1540:     receive hello -> ok end,
 1541:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1542:     unlink(P1),
 1543:     exit(P1, kill),
 1544:     unlink(P2),
 1545:     exit(P2, kill),
 1546:     false = is_process_alive(P1),
 1547:     false = is_process_alive(P2),
 1548:     ok.
 1549: 
 1550: %% Tests erlang:bump_reductions/1.
 1551: bump_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1552:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1553:     erlang:yield(),		% Clear reductions.
 1554:     {reductions,R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1555:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100),
 1556:     {reductions,R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1557:     case R2-R1 of
 1558: 	      Diff when Diff < 100 ->
 1559: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1560: 		  ct:fail({small_diff, Diff});
 1561: 	      Diff when Diff > 110 ->
 1562: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1563: 		  ct:fail({big_diff, Diff});
 1564: 	      Diff ->
 1565: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Diff]),
 1566: 		  ok
 1567: 	  end,
 1568: 
 1569:     %% Make sure that a bignum reduction doesn't crash the emulator (32-bit CPU).
 1570:     bump_big(R2, 16#08000000).
 1571: 
 1572: bump_big(Prev, Limit) ->
 1573:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100000), %Limited to CONTEXT_REDUCTIONS.
 1574:     case process_info(self(), reductions) of
 1575: 	      {reductions,Big} when is_integer(Big), Big > Limit ->
 1576: 		  erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1577: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Big]);
 1578: 	      {reductions,R} when is_integer(R), R > Prev ->
 1579: 		  bump_big(R, Limit)
 1580: 	  end,
 1581:     ok.
 1582: 
 1583: %% Priority 'low' should be mixed with 'normal' using a factor of
 1584: %% about 8. (OTP-2644)
 1585: low_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1586:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 1587:     Prop = low_prio_test(Config),
 1588:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 1589:     Str = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("Low/high proportion is ~.3f",
 1590:                                       [Prop])),
 1591:     {comment,Str}.
 1592: 
 1593: low_prio_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1594:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1595: 
 1596:     %% Spawn the server running with high priority. The server must
 1597:     %% not run at normal priority as that would skew the results for
 1598:     %% two reasons:
 1599:     %%
 1600:     %% 1. There would be one more normal-priority processes than
 1601:     %% low-priority processes.
 1602:     %%
 1603:     %% 2. The receive queue would grow faster than the server process
 1604:     %% could process it. That would in turn trigger the reduction
 1605:     %% punishment for the clients.
 1606:     S = spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_server, [0, 0], [link,{priority,high}]),
 1607: 
 1608:     %% Spawn the clients and let them run for a while.
 1609:     PCs = spawn_prio_clients(S, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
 1610:     ct:sleep({seconds,2}),
 1611:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> exit(P, kill) end, PCs),
 1612: 
 1613:     %% Stop the server and retrieve the result.
 1614:     S ! exit,
 1615:     receive
 1616:         {'EXIT', S, {A, B}} ->
 1617:             check_prio(A, B)
 1618:     end.
 1619: 
 1620: check_prio(A, B) ->
 1621:     Prop = A/B,
 1622:     ok = io:format("Low=~p, High=~p, Prop=~p\n", [A, B, Prop]),
 1623: 
 1624:     %% Prop is expected to be appr. 1/8. Allow a reasonable margin.
 1625:     true = Prop < 1/4,
 1626:     true = Prop > 1/16,
 1627:     Prop.
 1628: 
 1629: prio_server(A, B) ->
 1630:     receive
 1631: 	low ->
 1632: 	    prio_server(A+1, B);
 1633: 	normal ->
 1634: 	    prio_server(A, B+1);
 1635: 	exit ->
 1636: 	    exit({A, B})
 1637:     end.
 1638: 
 1639: spawn_prio_clients(_, 0) ->
 1640:     [];
 1641: spawn_prio_clients(S, N) ->
 1642:     [spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, normal], [link, {priority,normal}]),
 1643:      spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, low], [link, {priority,low}])
 1644:      | spawn_prio_clients(S, N-1)].
 1645: 
 1646: prio_client(S, Prio) ->
 1647:     S ! Prio,
 1648:     prio_client(S, Prio).
 1649: 
 1650: make_sub_binary(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 1651:     {_,B} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin]), 3),
 1652:     B;
 1653: make_sub_binary(List) ->
 1654:     make_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 1655: 
 1656: make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin0) ->
 1657:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 1658:     Sz = size(Bin0),
 1659:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
 1660:     Bin.
 1661: 
 1662: %% Tests erlang:yield/1
 1663: yield(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1664:     case catch erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
 1665: 	Level when is_integer(Level) ->
 1666: 	    {skipped,
 1667: 	     "Modified timing (level " ++ integer_to_list(Level)
 1668: 	     ++ ") is enabled. Testcase gets messed up by modified "
 1669: 	     "timing."};
 1670: 	_ ->
 1671: 	    MS = erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 1672: 	    yield_test(),
 1673: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 1674: 	    case MS of
 1675: 		blocked ->
 1676: 		    {comment,
 1677: 		     "Multi-scheduling blocked during test. This test-case "
 1678: 		     "was not written to work with multiple schedulers (the "
 1679: 		     "yield2 test-case tests almost the same thing)."};
 1680: 		_ ->
 1681: 		    ok
 1682: 	    end
 1683:     end.
 1684: 
 1685: yield_test() ->
 1686:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1687:     receive after 1 -> ok end,		% Clear reductions.
 1688:     SC = schedcnt(start),
 1689:     {reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1690:     {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1691:     true = call_yield(final),
 1692:     true = call_yield(),
 1693:     true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1694:     {reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1695:     Schedcnt = schedcnt(stop, SC),
 1696:     case {R2-R1, Schedcnt} of
 1697: 	{Diff, 4} when Diff < 30 ->
 1698: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 1699: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]);
 1700: 	{Diff, _} ->
 1701: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 1702: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]),
 1703: 	    ct:fail({measurement_error, Diff, Schedcnt})
 1704:     end.
 1705: 
 1706: call_yield() ->
 1707:     erlang:yield().
 1708: 
 1709: call_yield(middle) ->
 1710:     {ok, erlang:yield()};
 1711: call_yield(final) ->
 1712:     case self() of
 1713: 	Self when is_pid(Self) ->
 1714: 	    ok
 1715:     end,
 1716:     erlang:yield().
 1717: 
 1718: schedcnt(start) ->
 1719:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1720:     Fun = 
 1721: 	fun (F, Cnt) ->
 1722: 		receive
 1723: 		    {Ref, Parent} ->
 1724: 			Parent ! {Ref, Cnt}
 1725: 		after 0 ->
 1726: 			erlang:yield(),
 1727: 			F(F, Cnt+1)
 1728: 		end
 1729: 	end,
 1730:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () -> Fun(Fun, 0) end),
 1731:     {Ref, Pid}.
 1732: 
 1733: schedcnt(stop, {Ref, Pid}) when is_reference(Ref), is_pid(Pid) ->
 1734:     Pid ! {Ref, self()},
 1735:     receive
 1736: 	{Ref, Cnt} ->
 1737: 	    Cnt
 1738:     end.
 1739: 
 1740: yield2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1741:     Me = self(),
 1742:     Go = make_ref(),
 1743:     RedDiff = make_ref(),
 1744:     Done = make_ref(),
 1745:     P = spawn(fun () ->
 1746: 		receive Go -> ok end,
 1747: 		{reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1748: 		{ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1749: 		true = call_yield(final),
 1750: 		true = call_yield(),
 1751: 		true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1752: 		{reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1753: 		Me ! {RedDiff, R2 - R1},
 1754: 		exit(Done)
 1755: 	end),
 1756:     erlang:yield(),
 1757: 
 1758:     1 = erlang:trace(P, true, [running, procs, {tracer, self()}]),
 1759: 
 1760:     P ! Go,
 1761: 
 1762:     %% receive Go -> ok end,
 1763:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1764: 
 1765:     %% {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 1766:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1767:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1768: 
 1769:     %% true = call_yield(final),
 1770:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1771:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1772: 
 1773:     %% true = call_yield(),
 1774:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1775:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1776: 
 1777:     %% true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 1778:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1779:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 1780: 
 1781:     %% exit(Done)
 1782:     {trace, P, exit, Done} = next_tmsg(P),
 1783: 
 1784: 
 1785:     receive
 1786: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} when Reductions < 30, Reductions > 0 ->
 1787: 		  io:format("Reductions = ~p~n", [Reductions]),
 1788: 		  ok;
 1789: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} ->
 1790: 		  ct:fail({unexpected_reduction_count, Reductions})
 1791: 	  end,
 1792: 
 1793:     none = next_tmsg(P),
 1794: 
 1795:     ok.
 1796: 
 1797: next_tmsg(Pid) ->
 1798:     receive
 1799: 	TMsg when is_tuple(TMsg),
 1800: 		  element(1, TMsg) == trace,
 1801: 		  element(2, TMsg) == Pid ->
 1802: 	    TMsg
 1803:     after 100 ->
 1804: 	    none
 1805:     end.
 1806: 
 1807: dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1808:     %% Verification of nc reference counts when stopping node
 1809:     %% will find the bug if it exists...
 1810:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1811:     ParentFun =
 1812:         fun () ->
 1813:                 %% Give parent some work to do when
 1814:                 %% exiting to increase the likelyhood
 1815:                 %% of the bug triggereing...
 1816:                 T = ets:new(x,[]),
 1817:                 ets:insert(T, lists:map(fun (I) ->
 1818:                                                 {I,I}
 1819:                                         end,
 1820:                                         lists:seq(1,10000))),
 1821:                 Chld = spawn_link(Node,
 1822:                                   fun () ->
 1823:                                           receive
 1824:                                           after infinity ->
 1825:                                                   ok
 1826:                                           end
 1827:                                   end),
 1828:                 erlang:yield(),
 1829:                 unlink(Chld),
 1830:                 exit(bye)
 1831:         end,
 1832:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1833:                             spawn_monitor(ParentFun)
 1834:                     end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 1835:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 1836:                           receive
 1837:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, bye} ->
 1838:                                   ok
 1839:                           end
 1840:                   end, PMs),
 1841:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1842:     ok.
 1843: 
 1844: %% Test that bad arguments to register/2 cause an exception.
 1845: bad_register(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1846:     Name = a_long_and_unused_name,
 1847: 
 1848:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register({bad,name}, self())),
 1849:     fail_register(undefined, self()),
 1850:     fail_register([bad,name], self()),
 1851: 
 1852:     {Dead,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> true end),
 1853:     receive
 1854: 	{'DOWN',Mref,process,Dead,_} -> ok
 1855:     end,
 1856:     fail_register(Name, Dead),
 1857:     fail_register(Name, make_ref()),
 1858:     fail_register(Name, []),
 1859:     fail_register(Name, {bad,process}),
 1860:     fail_register(Name, <<>>),
 1861:     ok.
 1862: 
 1863: fail_register(Name, Process) ->
 1864:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register(Name, Process)),
 1865:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Name ! anything_goes),
 1866:     ok.
 1867: 
 1868: garbage_collect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1869:     Prio = process_flag(priority, high),
 1870:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1871:     
 1872:     TokLoopers = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1873: 		spawn_opt(fun tok_loop/0, [{priority, low}, link])
 1874: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 1875: 
 1876:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 1877: 		Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1878: 		DownBefore = receive
 1879: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 1880: 			true
 1881: 		after 0 ->
 1882: 			false
 1883: 		end,
 1884: 		GC = erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1885: 		DownAfter = receive
 1886: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 1887: 			true
 1888: 		after 0 ->
 1889: 			false
 1890: 		end,
 1891: 		true = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 1892: 		case {DownBefore, DownAfter} of
 1893: 		    {true, _} -> false = GC;
 1894: 		    {false, false} -> true = GC;
 1895: 		    _ -> GC
 1896: 		end
 1897: 	end, processes()),
 1898: 
 1899:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 1900: 		unlink(Pid),
 1901: 		exit(Pid, bang)
 1902: 	end, TokLoopers),
 1903:     process_flag(priority, Prio),
 1904:     ok.
 1905: 
 1906: %% This used to cause the nofrag emulator to dump core
 1907: process_info_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1908:     process_info_messages_test(),
 1909:     ok.
 1910: 
 1911: process_info_messages_loop(0) -> ok;
 1912: process_info_messages_loop(N) -> process_info_messages_loop(N-1).
 1913: 
 1914: process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr) ->
 1915:     receive
 1916: 	Msg ->
 1917: 	    Rcvr ! Msg,
 1918: 	    process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr)
 1919:     after 0 ->
 1920: 	    ok
 1921:     end.
 1922: 
 1923: process_info_messages_test() ->
 1924:     Go = make_ref(),
 1925:     Done = make_ref(),
 1926:     Rcvr = self(),
 1927:     Rcvr2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1928: 		receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 1929: 		garbage_collect(),
 1930: 		Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 1931: 	end),
 1932:     Sndrs = lists:map(
 1933: 	fun (_) ->
 1934: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 1935: 			    Rcvr ! {Go, self()},
 1936: 			    receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 1937: 			    BigData = lists:seq(1, 1000),
 1938: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 1939: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 1940: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 1941: 			    Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 1942: 		    end)
 1943: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 1944:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Go, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 1945: 			Sndrs),
 1946:     garbage_collect(),
 1947:     erlang:yield(),
 1948:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> Sndr ! {Go, self()} end, Sndrs),
 1949:     process_info_messages_loop(100000000),
 1950:     Msgs = process_info(self(), messages),
 1951:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Done, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 1952: 			Sndrs),
 1953:     garbage_collect(),
 1954:     Rcvr2 ! Msgs,
 1955:     process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr2),
 1956:     Rcvr2 ! {Go, self()},
 1957:     garbage_collect(),
 1958:     receive {Done, Rcvr2} -> ok end,
 1959:     Msgs.
 1960: 
 1961: chk_badarg(Fun) ->
 1962:     try Fun(), exit(no_badarg) catch error:badarg -> ok end.
 1963: 
 1964: process_flag_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1965:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, banan) end),
 1966:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(trap_exit, gurka) end),
 1967:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(error_handler, 1) end),
 1968:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(fullsweep_after, gurka) end),
 1969:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_heap_size, gurka) end),
 1970:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, gurka) end),
 1971:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, -1) end),
 1972: 
 1973:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, gurka) end),
 1974:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, -1) end),
 1975:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 1976:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 1977:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, Min - 1)
 1978:                end),
 1979:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 1980:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 1981:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, #{size => Min - 1})
 1982:                end),
 1983:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{}) end),
 1984:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ kill => true }) end),
 1985:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 1986:                                                         kill => gurka }) end),
 1987:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 1988:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 1989:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 1990:                                                         kill => true,
 1991:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 1992:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 1 bsl 64 }) end),
 1993: 
 1994:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(priority, 4711) end),
 1995:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(save_calls, hmmm) end),
 1996:     {P,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> receive "in vain" -> no end end),
 1997:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, hmmm) end),
 1998:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, save_calls, hmmm) end),
 1999:     exit(P, die),
 2000:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, 0) end),
 2001:     {'DOWN', Mref, process, P, die} = receive M -> M end,
 2002:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, 0) end),
 2003:     ok.
 2004: 
 2005: -include_lib("stdlib/include/ms_transform.hrl").
 2006: 
 2007: otp_6237(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2008:     Slctrs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2009: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 2010: 			    otp_6237_select_loop()
 2011: 		    end)
 2012: 	end,
 2013: 	lists:seq(1,5)),
 2014:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> otp_6237_test() end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 2015:     lists:foreach(fun (S) -> unlink(S),exit(S, kill) end, Slctrs), 
 2016:     ok.
 2017: 				
 2018: otp_6237_test() ->
 2019:     Parent = self(),
 2020:     Inited = make_ref(),
 2021:     Die = make_ref(),
 2022:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2023: 		register(otp_6237,self()),
 2024: 		otp_6237 = ets:new(otp_6237,
 2025: 		    [named_table,
 2026: 			ordered_set]),
 2027: 		ets:insert(otp_6237,
 2028: 		    [{I,I}
 2029: 			|| I <- lists:seq(1, 100)]),
 2030: 		%% Inserting a lot of bif timers
 2031: 		%% increase the possibility that
 2032: 		%% the test will fail when the
 2033: 		%% original cleanup order is used
 2034: 		lists:foreach( fun (_) ->
 2035: 			    erlang:send_after(1000000, self(), {a,b,c})
 2036: 		    end, lists:seq(1,1000)),
 2037: 		Parent ! Inited,
 2038: 		receive Die -> bye end
 2039: 	end),
 2040:     receive
 2041: 	Inited -> ok
 2042:     end,
 2043:     Pid ! Die,
 2044:     otp_6237_whereis_loop().
 2045: 
 2046: otp_6237_whereis_loop() ->
 2047:     case whereis(otp_6237) of
 2048: 	      undefined ->
 2049: 		  otp_6237 = ets:new(otp_6237,
 2050: 					   [named_table,ordered_set]),
 2051: 		  ets:delete(otp_6237),
 2052: 		  ok;
 2053: 	      _ ->
 2054: 		  otp_6237_whereis_loop()
 2055: 	  end.
 2056: 	     
 2057: otp_6237_select_loop() ->
 2058:     catch ets:select(otp_6237, ets:fun2ms(fun({K, does_not_exist}) -> K end)),
 2059:     otp_6237_select_loop().
 2060: 
 2061: 
 2062: -define(NoTestProcs, 10000).
 2063: -record(ptab_list_bif_info, {min_start_reds,
 2064: 			     tab_chunks,
 2065: 			     tab_chunks_size,
 2066: 			     tab_indices_per_red,
 2067: 			     free_term_proc_reds,
 2068: 			     term_procs_per_red,
 2069: 			     term_procs_max_reds,
 2070: 			     conses_per_red,
 2071: 			     debug_level}).
 2072: 
 2073: processes_large_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2074:     sys_mem_cond_run(2048, fun () -> processes_large_tab_test() end).
 2075: 
 2076: processes_large_tab_test() ->
 2077:     enable_internal_state(),
 2078:     MaxDbgLvl = 20,
 2079:     MinProcTabSize = 2*(1 bsl 15),
 2080:     ProcTabSize0 = 1000000,
 2081:     ProcTabSize1 = case {erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2082: 	    erlang:system_info(logical_processors)} of
 2083: 	{Schdlrs, Cpus} when is_integer(Cpus),
 2084: 	Schdlrs =< Cpus ->
 2085: 	    ProcTabSize0;
 2086: 	_ ->
 2087: 	    ProcTabSize0 div 4
 2088:     end,
 2089:     BT = erlang:system_info(build_type),
 2090:     ProcTabSize2 = case (BT =:= debug) or (BT =:= valgrind) of
 2091: 	true -> ProcTabSize1 - 500000;
 2092: 	false -> ProcTabSize1
 2093:     end,
 2094:     %% With high debug levels this test takes so long time that
 2095:     %% the connection times out; therefore, shrink the test on
 2096:     %% high debug levels.
 2097:     DbgLvl = case erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info) of
 2098: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} when Lvl > MaxDbgLvl ->
 2099: 			   20;
 2100: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} when Lvl < 0 ->
 2101: 			   ct:fail({debug_level, Lvl});
 2102: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} ->
 2103: 			   Lvl
 2104: 		   end,
 2105:     ProcTabSize3 = ProcTabSize2 - (1300000 * DbgLvl div MaxDbgLvl),
 2106:     ProcTabSize = case ProcTabSize3 < MinProcTabSize of
 2107: 			    true -> MinProcTabSize;
 2108: 			    false -> ProcTabSize3
 2109: 			end,
 2110:     {ok, Peer, LargeNode} = ?CT_PEER(["+P", integer_to_list(ProcTabSize)]),
 2111:     Res = rpc:call(LargeNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2112:     case rpc:call(LargeNode,
 2113: 			erts_debug,
 2114: 			get_internal_state,
 2115: 			[processes_bif_info]) of
 2116: 	      #ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks} when is_integer(Chunks),
 2117: 							    Chunks > 1 -> ok;
 2118: 	      PBInfo -> ct:fail(PBInfo)
 2119: 	  end,
 2120:     stop_node(Peer, LargeNode),
 2121:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2122: 
 2123: processes_default_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2124:     sys_mem_cond_run(1024, fun () -> processes_default_tab_test() end).
 2125: 
 2126: processes_default_tab_test() ->
 2127:     {ok, Peer, DefaultNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2128:     Res = rpc:call(DefaultNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2129:     stop_node(Peer, DefaultNode),
 2130:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2131: 
 2132: processes_small_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2133:     {ok, Peer, SmallNode} = ?CT_PEER(["+P","1024"]),
 2134:     Res    = rpc:call(SmallNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2135:     PBInfo = rpc:call(SmallNode, erts_debug, get_internal_state, [processes_bif_info]),
 2136:     stop_node(Peer, SmallNode),
 2137:     true = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.tab_chunks < 10,
 2138:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2139: 
 2140: processes_this_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2141:     Mem = case {erlang:system_info(build_type),
 2142:                 erlang:system_info(allocator)} of
 2143:               {lcnt, {_, _Vsn, [sys_alloc], _Opts}} ->
 2144:                   %% When running +Mea min + lcnt we may need more memory
 2145:                   1024 * 4;
 2146:               _ ->
 2147:                   1024
 2148:           end,
 2149:     sys_mem_cond_run(Mem, fun () -> chk_processes_bif_test_res(processes_bif_test()) end).
 2150: 
 2151: chk_processes_bif_test_res(ok) -> ok;
 2152: chk_processes_bif_test_res({comment, _} = Comment) -> Comment;
 2153: chk_processes_bif_test_res(Failure) -> ct:fail(Failure).
 2154: 
 2155: print_processes_bif_info(#ptab_list_bif_info{min_start_reds = MinStartReds,
 2156: 					     tab_chunks = TabChunks,
 2157: 					     tab_chunks_size = TabChunksSize,
 2158: 					     tab_indices_per_red = TabIndPerRed,
 2159: 					     free_term_proc_reds = FreeTPReds,
 2160: 					     term_procs_per_red = TPPerRed,
 2161: 					     term_procs_max_reds = TPMaxReds,
 2162: 					     conses_per_red = ConsesPerRed,
 2163: 					     debug_level = DbgLvl}) ->
 2164:     io:format("processes/0 bif info on node ~p:~n"
 2165: 	      "Min start reductions = ~p~n"
 2166: 	      "Process table chunks = ~p~n"
 2167: 	      "Process table chunks size = ~p~n"
 2168: 	      "Process table indices per reduction = ~p~n"
 2169: 	      "Reduction cost for free() on terminated process struct = ~p~n"
 2170: 	      "Inspect terminated processes per reduction = ~p~n"
 2171: 	      "Max reductions during inspection of terminated processes = ~p~n"
 2172: 	      "Create cons-cells per reduction = ~p~n"
 2173: 	      "Debug level = ~p~n",
 2174: 	      [node(),
 2175: 	       MinStartReds,
 2176: 	       TabChunks,
 2177: 	       TabChunksSize,
 2178: 	       TabIndPerRed,
 2179: 	       FreeTPReds,
 2180: 	       TPPerRed,
 2181: 	       TPMaxReds,
 2182: 	       ConsesPerRed,
 2183: 	       DbgLvl]).
 2184: 
 2185: processes_bif_cleaner() ->
 2186:     receive {'EXIT', _, _} -> ok end,
 2187:     processes_bif_cleaner().
 2188: 
 2189: spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner) ->
 2190:     TabSz = erlang:system_info(process_limit),
 2191:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_pid,TabSz),
 2192:     spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner,
 2193: 			      TabSz,
 2194: 			      TabSz*2,
 2195: 			      0,
 2196: 			      []).
 2197: 
 2198: processes_unexpected_result(CorrectProcs, Procs) ->
 2199:     ProcInfo = [registered_name,
 2200: 		initial_call,
 2201: 		current_function,
 2202: 		status,
 2203: 		priority],
 2204:     MissingProcs = CorrectProcs -- Procs,
 2205:     io:format("Missing processes: ~p",
 2206: 	      [lists:map(fun (Pid) ->
 2207: 				 [{pid, Pid}
 2208: 				  | case process_info(Pid, ProcInfo) of
 2209: 					undefined -> [];
 2210: 					Res -> Res
 2211: 				    end]
 2212: 			 end,
 2213: 			 MissingProcs)]),
 2214:     SuperfluousProcs = Procs -- CorrectProcs,
 2215:     io:format("Superfluous processes: ~p",
 2216: 	      [lists:map(fun (Pid) ->
 2217: 				 [{pid, Pid}
 2218: 				  | case process_info(Pid, ProcInfo) of
 2219: 					undefined -> [];
 2220: 					Res -> Res
 2221: 				    end]
 2222: 			 end,
 2223: 			 SuperfluousProcs)]),
 2224:     ct:fail(unexpected_result).
 2225: 
 2226: hangaround(Cleaner, Type) ->
 2227:     %% Type is only used to distinguish different processes from
 2228:     %% when doing process_info
 2229:     try link(Cleaner) catch error:Reason -> exit(Reason) end,
 2230:     receive after infinity -> ok end,
 2231:     exit(Type).
 2232: 
 2233: spawn_initial_hangarounds(_Cleaner, NP, Max, Len, HAs) when NP > Max ->
 2234:     {Len, HAs};
 2235: spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner, NP, Max, Len, HAs) ->
 2236:     Skip = 30,
 2237:     wait_for_proc_slots(Skip+3),
 2238:     HA1 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2239: 		    [{priority, low}]),
 2240:     HA2 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2241: 		    [{priority, normal}]),
 2242:     HA3 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2243: 		    [{priority, high}]),
 2244:     spawn_drop(Skip),
 2245:     spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner, NP+Skip, Max, Len+3, [HA1,HA2,HA3|HAs]).
 2246: 
 2247: wait_for_proc_slots(MinFreeSlots) ->
 2248:     case erlang:system_info(process_limit) - erlang:system_info(process_count) of
 2249:         FreeSlots when FreeSlots < MinFreeSlots ->
 2250:             receive after 10 -> ok end,
 2251:             wait_for_proc_slots(MinFreeSlots);
 2252:         _FreeSlots ->
 2253:             ok
 2254:     end.
 2255: 
 2256: spawn_drop(N) when N =< 0 ->
 2257:     ok;
 2258: spawn_drop(N) ->
 2259:     spawn(fun () -> ok end),
 2260:     spawn_drop(N-1).
 2261: 
 2262: do_processes(WantReds) ->
 2263:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2264:     processes().
 2265: 
 2266: processes_bif_test() ->
 2267:     Tester = self(),
 2268:     enable_internal_state(),
 2269:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2270:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2271:     WantReds = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds + 10,
 2272:     WillTrap = case PBInfo of
 2273: 	#ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks} when Chunks < 10 ->
 2274: 	    false; %% Skip for small tables
 2275: 	#ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks,
 2276: 	    tab_chunks_size = ChunksSize,
 2277: 	    tab_indices_per_red = IndiciesPerRed
 2278: 	} ->
 2279: 	    Chunks*ChunksSize >= IndiciesPerRed*WantReds
 2280:     end,
 2281:     Processes = fun () ->
 2282: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,WantReds),
 2283: 	    processes()
 2284:     end,
 2285: 
 2286:     ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, WillTrap, Processes),
 2287: 
 2288:     case WillTrap of
 2289: 	false ->
 2290: 	    ok;
 2291: 	true ->
 2292: 	    %% Do it against with a process suspended while
 2293: 	    %% in the processes/0 bif.
 2294: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2295: 	    Suspendee = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2296: 						 Tester ! {suspend_me, self()},
 2297: 						 Tester ! {self(),
 2298: 							   done,
 2299: 							   hd(Processes())},
 2300: 						 receive
 2301: 						 after infinity ->
 2302: 							 ok
 2303: 						 end
 2304: 					 end),
 2305: 	    receive {suspend_me, Suspendee} -> ok end,
 2306: 	    erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee),
 2307: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2308: 	    
 2309: 	    [{status,suspended},{current_function,{erlang,ptab_list_continue,2}}] =
 2310: 		process_info(Suspendee, [status, current_function]),
 2311: 
 2312: 	    ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, WillTrap, Processes),
 2313: 	    
 2314: 	    erlang:resume_process(Suspendee),
 2315: 	    receive {Suspendee, done, _} -> ok end,
 2316: 	    unlink(Suspendee),
 2317: 	    exit(Suspendee, bang)
 2318:     end,
 2319:     case get(processes_bif_testcase_comment) of
 2320: 	undefined -> ok;
 2321: 	Comment -> {comment, Comment}
 2322:     end.
 2323:     
 2324: do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, DieTest, Processes) ->
 2325:     Tester = self(),
 2326:     SpawnProcesses = fun (Prio) ->
 2327: 	    spawn_opt(?MODULE, do_processes, [WantReds], [link, {priority, Prio}])
 2328:     end,
 2329:     Cleaner = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2330: 		process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2331: 		Tester ! {cleaner_alive, self()},
 2332: 		processes_bif_cleaner()
 2333: 	end),
 2334:     receive {cleaner_alive, Cleaner} -> ok end,
 2335:     try
 2336: 	DoIt = make_ref(),
 2337: 	GetGoing = make_ref(),
 2338: 	{NoTestProcs, TestProcs} = spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner),
 2339: 	io:format("Testing with ~p processes~n", [NoTestProcs]),
 2340: 	SpawnHangAround = fun () ->
 2341: 		spawn(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, new_hangaround])
 2342: 	end,
 2343: 	Killer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 2344: 		    Splt = NoTestProcs div 10,
 2345: 		    {TP1, TP23} = lists:split(Splt, TestProcs),
 2346: 		    {TP2, TP3} = lists:split(Splt, TP23),
 2347: 		    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2348: 		    Tester ! DoIt,
 2349: 		    receive GetGoing -> ok end,
 2350: 		    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2351: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2352: 		    lists:foreach( fun (P) ->
 2353: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2354: 				exit(P, bang)
 2355: 			end, TP1),
 2356: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2357: 		    erlang:yield(),
 2358: 		    lists:foreach( fun (P) ->
 2359: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2360: 				exit(P, bang)
 2361: 			end, TP2),
 2362: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2363: 		    lists:foreach(
 2364: 			fun (P) ->
 2365: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2366: 				exit(P, bang)
 2367: 			end, TP3)
 2368: 	    end, [{priority, high}, link]),
 2369: 	receive DoIt -> ok end,
 2370: 	process_flag(priority, low),
 2371: 	SpawnProcesses(low),
 2372: 	erlang:yield(),
 2373: 	process_flag(priority, normal),
 2374: 	CorrectProcs0 = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes),
 2375: 	Killer ! GetGoing,
 2376: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2377: 	Procs0 = processes(),
 2378: 	Procs = lists:sort(Procs0),
 2379: 	CorrectProcs = lists:sort(CorrectProcs0),
 2380: 	LengthCorrectProcs = length(CorrectProcs),
 2381: 	io:format("~p = length(CorrectProcs)~n", [LengthCorrectProcs]),
 2382: 	true = LengthCorrectProcs > NoTestProcs,
 2383: 	case CorrectProcs =:= Procs of
 2384: 	    true ->
 2385: 		ok;
 2386: 	    false ->
 2387: 		processes_unexpected_result(CorrectProcs, Procs)
 2388: 	end,
 2389: 	unlink(Killer),
 2390: 	exit(Killer, bang)
 2391:     after
 2392: 	unlink(Cleaner),
 2393:         exit(Cleaner, kill),
 2394:         %% Wait for the system to recover to a normal state...
 2395: 	wait_until_system_recover()
 2396:     end,
 2397:     do_processes_bif_die_test(DieTest, Processes),
 2398:     ok.
 2399: 
 2400: 
 2401: do_processes_bif_die_test(false, _Processes) ->
 2402:     io:format("Skipping test killing process executing processes/0~n",[]),
 2403:     ok;
 2404: do_processes_bif_die_test(true, Processes) ->
 2405:     do_processes_bif_die_test(5, Processes);
 2406: do_processes_bif_die_test(N, Processes) ->
 2407:     io:format("Doing test killing process executing processes/0~n",[]),
 2408:     try
 2409: 	Tester = self(),
 2410: 	Oooh_Nooooooo = make_ref(),
 2411: 	{_, DieWhileDoingMon} = erlang:spawn_monitor( fun () ->
 2412: 		    Victim = self(),
 2413: 		    spawn_opt(
 2414: 			fun () ->
 2415: 				exit(Victim, got_him)
 2416: 			end,
 2417: 			[link, {priority, max}]),
 2418: 		    Tester ! {Oooh_Nooooooo,
 2419: 			hd(Processes())},
 2420: 		    exit(ohhhh_nooooo)
 2421: 	    end),
 2422: 	receive
 2423: 	    {'DOWN', DieWhileDoingMon, _, _, Reason} ->
 2424: 		case Reason of
 2425: 		    got_him -> ok;
 2426: 		    _ -> throw({kill_in_trap, Reason})
 2427: 		end
 2428: 	end,
 2429: 	receive
 2430: 	    {Oooh_Nooooooo, _} ->
 2431: 		throw({kill_in_trap, 'Oooh_Nooooooo'})
 2432: 	after 0 ->
 2433: 		ok
 2434: 	end,
 2435: 	PrcsCllrsSeqLen = 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2436: 	PrcsCllrsSeq = lists:seq(1, PrcsCllrsSeqLen),
 2437: 	ProcsCallers = lists:map( fun (_) ->
 2438: 		    spawn_link(
 2439: 			fun () ->
 2440: 				Tester ! hd(Processes())
 2441: 			end)
 2442: 	    end, PrcsCllrsSeq),
 2443: 	erlang:yield(),
 2444: 	{ProcsCallers1, ProcsCallers2} = lists:split(PrcsCllrsSeqLen div 2,
 2445: 						     ProcsCallers),
 2446: 	process_flag(priority, high),
 2447: 	lists:foreach(
 2448: 		fun (P) ->
 2449: 			unlink(P),
 2450: 			exit(P, bang)
 2451: 		end,
 2452: 		lists:reverse(ProcsCallers2) ++ ProcsCallers1),
 2453: 	process_flag(priority, normal),
 2454: 	ok
 2455:     catch
 2456: 	throw:{kill_in_trap, R} when N > 0 ->
 2457: 	    io:format("Failed to kill in trap: ~p~n", [R]),
 2458: 	    io:format("Trying again~n", []),
 2459: 	    do_processes_bif_die_test(N-1, Processes)
 2460:     end.
 2461: 	    
 2462: 
 2463: wait_until_system_recover() ->
 2464:     %% If system hasn't recovered after 10 seconds we give up
 2465:     Tmr = erlang:start_timer(10000, self(), no_more_wait),
 2466:     wait_until_system_recover(Tmr).
 2467: 
 2468: wait_until_system_recover(Tmr) ->
 2469:     try
 2470: 	lists:foreach(fun (P) when P == self() ->
 2471: 			      ok;
 2472: 			  (P) ->
 2473: 			      case process_info(P, initial_call) of
 2474: 				  {initial_call,{?MODULE, _, _}} ->
 2475: 				      throw(wait);
 2476: 				  {initial_call,{_, _, _}} ->
 2477: 				      ok;
 2478: 				  undefined ->
 2479: 				      ok
 2480: 			      end
 2481: 		      end,
 2482: 		      processes())
 2483:     catch
 2484: 	throw:wait ->
 2485: 	    receive
 2486: 		{timeout, Tmr, _} ->
 2487: 		    Comment = "WARNING: Test processes still hanging around!",
 2488: 		    io:format("~s~n", [Comment]),
 2489: 		    put(processes_bif_testcase_comment, Comment),
 2490: 		    lists:foreach(
 2491: 		      fun (P) when P == self() ->
 2492: 			      ok;
 2493: 			  (P) ->
 2494: 			      case process_info(P, initial_call) of
 2495: 				  {initial_call,{?MODULE, _, _} = MFA} ->
 2496: 				      io:format("~p ~p~n", [P, MFA]);
 2497: 				  {initial_call,{_, _, _}} ->
 2498: 				      ok;
 2499: 				  undefined ->
 2500: 				      ok
 2501: 			      end
 2502: 		      end,
 2503: 		      processes())
 2504: 	    after 100 ->
 2505: 		    wait_until_system_recover(Tmr)
 2506: 	    end
 2507:     end,
 2508:     erlang:cancel_timer(Tmr),
 2509:     receive {timeout, Tmr, _} -> ok after 0 -> ok end,
 2510:     ok.
 2511: 
 2512: processes_last_call_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2513:     enable_internal_state(),
 2514:     Processes = fun () -> processes() end,
 2515:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2516:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2517:     WantReds = case PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds of
 2518: 	R when R > 10 -> R - 1;
 2519: 	_R -> 9
 2520:     end,
 2521:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2522: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2523: 		    WantReds),
 2524: 		Processes(),
 2525: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2526: 		    WantReds),
 2527: 		my_processes()
 2528: 	end,
 2529: 	lists:seq(1,100)).
 2530:     
 2531: my_processes() ->
 2532:     processes().
 2533: 
 2534: processes_apply_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2535:     enable_internal_state(),
 2536:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2537:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2538:     WantReds = case PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds of
 2539: 	R when R > 10 -> R - 1;
 2540: 	_R -> 9
 2541:     end,
 2542:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2543: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2544: 		    WantReds),
 2545: 		apply(erlang, processes, [])
 2546: 	end, lists:seq(1,100)).
 2547: 
 2548: processes_gc_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2549:     Tester = self(),
 2550:     enable_internal_state(),
 2551:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2552:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2553:     WantReds = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds + 10,
 2554:     Processes = fun () ->
 2555: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,WantReds),
 2556: 	    processes()
 2557:     end,
 2558: 
 2559:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2560:     Suspendee = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2561: 					 Tester ! {suspend_me, self()},
 2562: 					 Tester ! {self(),
 2563: 						   done,
 2564: 						   hd(Processes())},
 2565: 					 receive after infinity -> ok end
 2566: 				 end),
 2567:     receive {suspend_me, Suspendee} -> ok end,
 2568:     erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee),
 2569:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2570: 	    
 2571:     [{status,suspended}, {current_function,{erlang,ptab_list_continue,2}}]
 2572: 	= process_info(Suspendee, [status, current_function]),
 2573: 
 2574:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2575:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2576: 	    
 2577:     erlang:resume_process(Suspendee),
 2578:     receive {Suspendee, done, _} -> ok end,
 2579:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2580:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 2581: 
 2582:     unlink(Suspendee),
 2583:     exit(Suspendee, bang),
 2584:     ok.
 2585: 
 2586: process_flag_fullsweep_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2587:     {fullsweep_after, OldFSA} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2588:     OldFSA = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 12345),
 2589:     {fullsweep_after, 12345} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2590:     12345 = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 0),
 2591:     {fullsweep_after, 0} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 2592:     0 = process_flag(fullsweep_after, OldFSA),
 2593:     ok.
 2594: 
 2595: process_flag_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2596:     HSize  = 2586,   % must be gc fib+ number
 2597:     VHSize = 318187, % must be gc fib+ number
 2598:     OldHmin = erlang:process_flag(min_heap_size, HSize),
 2599:     {min_heap_size, HSize} = erlang:process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2600:     OldVHmin = erlang:process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize),
 2601:     {min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize} = erlang:process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
 2602:     HSize = erlang:process_flag(min_heap_size, OldHmin),
 2603:     VHSize = erlang:process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, OldVHmin),
 2604:     ok.
 2605: 
 2606: %% test that max_heap_size is correctly handled when passed via command line
 2607: command_line_max_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2608:     %% test maximum heap size
 2609:     HMax = case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 2610:                8 -> (1 bsl 59) - 1;
 2611:                4 -> (1 bsl 27) - 1
 2612:            end,
 2613:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+hmax", integer_to_list(HMax)]),
 2614:     Pid = erlang:spawn(Node, fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 2615:     {max_heap_size, #{size := HMax}} = rpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [Pid, max_heap_size]),
 2616:     peer:stop(Peer).
 2617: 
 2618: spawn_opt_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2619:     HSize  = 987,   % must be gc fib+ number
 2620:     VHSize = 46422, % must be gc fib+ number
 2621:     Pid  = spawn_opt(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end,
 2622: 	[{min_heap_size, HSize},{ min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize}]),
 2623:     {min_heap_size, HSize} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
 2624:     {min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
 2625:     Pid ! stop,
 2626:     ok.
 2627: 
 2628: spawn_opt_max_heap_size(_Config) ->
 2629: 
 2630:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 2631: 
 2632:     %% flush any prior messages in error_logger
 2633:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> ok = nok end),
 2634:     receive
 2635:         {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2636:             flush()
 2637:     end,
 2638: 
 2639:     %% Test that numerical limit works
 2640:     max_heap_size_test(1024, 1024, true, true),
 2641: 
 2642:     %% Test that map limit works
 2643:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => 1024 }, 1024, true, true),
 2644: 
 2645:     %% Test that no kill is sent
 2646:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => 1024, kill => false }, 1024, false, true),
 2647: 
 2648:     %% Test that no error_logger report is sent
 2649:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => 1024, error_logger => false }, 1024, true, false),
 2650: 
 2651:     %% Test that system_flag works
 2652:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 0, kill => false,
 2653:                                          error_logger => true}),
 2654:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => 1024 }, 1024, false, true),
 2655:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => 1024, kill => true }, 1024, true, true),
 2656: 
 2657:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 0, kill => true,
 2658:                                          error_logger => false}),
 2659:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => 1024 }, 1024, true, false),
 2660:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => 1024, error_logger => true }, 1024, true, true),
 2661: 
 2662:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 1 bsl 20, kill => true,
 2663:                                          error_logger => true}),
 2664:     max_heap_size_test(#{ }, 1 bsl 20, true, true),
 2665: 
 2666:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 0, kill => true,
 2667:                                          error_logger => true}),
 2668: 
 2669:     %% Test that ordinary case works as expected again
 2670:     max_heap_size_test(1024, 1024, true, true),
 2671: 
 2672:     error_logger:delete_report_handler(?MODULE),
 2673: 
 2674:     ok.
 2675: 
 2676: max_heap_size_test(Option, Size, Kill, ErrorLogger)
 2677:   when map_size(Option) == 0 ->
 2678:     max_heap_size_test([], Size, Kill, ErrorLogger);
 2679: max_heap_size_test(Option, Size, Kill, ErrorLogger)
 2680:   when is_map(Option); is_integer(Option) ->
 2681:     max_heap_size_test([{max_heap_size, Option}], Size, Kill, ErrorLogger);
 2682: max_heap_size_test(Option, Size, Kill, ErrorLogger) ->
 2683:     OomFun = fun () -> oom_fun([]) end,
 2684:     Pid = spawn_opt(OomFun, Option),
 2685:     {max_heap_size, MHSz} = erlang:process_info(Pid, max_heap_size),
 2686:     ct:log("Default: ~p~nOption: ~p~nProc: ~p~n",
 2687:            [erlang:system_info(max_heap_size), Option, MHSz]),
 2688: 
 2689:     #{ size := Size} = MHSz,
 2690: 
 2691:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 2692:     if Kill ->
 2693:             receive
 2694:                 {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, killed} ->
 2695:                     ok
 2696:             end;
 2697:        true ->
 2698:             ok
 2699:     end,
 2700:     if ErrorLogger ->
 2701:             receive
 2702:                 %% There must be at least one error message.
 2703:                 {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2704:                     ok
 2705:             end;
 2706:        true ->
 2707:             ok
 2708:     end,
 2709:     if not Kill ->
 2710:             exit(Pid, die),
 2711:             receive
 2712:                 {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, die} ->
 2713:                     ok
 2714:             end,
 2715:             %% If the process was not killed, the limit may have
 2716:             %% been reached more than once and there may be
 2717:             %% more {error, ...} messages left.
 2718:             receive_error_messages(Pid);
 2719:        true ->
 2720:             ok
 2721:     end,
 2722: 
 2723:     %% Make sure that there are no unexpected messages.
 2724:     receive_unexpected().
 2725: 
 2726: oom_fun(Acc0) ->
 2727:     %% This is tail-recursive since the compiler is smart enough to figure
 2728:     %% out that a body-recursive variant never returns, and loops forever
 2729:     %% without keeping the list alive.
 2730:     timer:sleep(5),
 2731:     oom_fun([lists:seq(1, 1000) | Acc0]).
 2732: 
 2733: receive_error_messages(Pid) ->
 2734:     receive
 2735:         {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 2736:             receive_error_messages(Pid)
 2737:     after 1000 ->
 2738:             ok
 2739:     end.
 2740: 
 2741: receive_unexpected() ->
 2742:     receive
 2743:         {info_report, _, _} ->
 2744:             %% May be an alarm message from os_mon. Ignore.
 2745:             receive_unexpected();
 2746:         M ->
 2747:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, M})
 2748:     after 10 ->
 2749:             ok
 2750:     end.
 2751: 
 2752: flush() ->
 2753:     receive
 2754:         _M -> flush()
 2755:     after 0 ->
 2756:             ok
 2757:     end.
 2758: 
 2759: %% Make sure that when maximum allowed heap size is exceeded, the
 2760: %% process will actually terminate.
 2761: %%
 2762: %% Despite the timetrap and limit of number of iterations, bugs
 2763: %% provoked by the test case can cause the runtime system to hang in
 2764: %% this test case.
 2765: more_spawn_opt_max_heap_size(_Config) ->
 2766:     ct:timetrap({minutes,1}),
 2767:     Funs = [fun build_and_bif/0,
 2768:             fun build_bin_and_bif/0,
 2769:             fun build_and_recv_timeout/0,
 2770:             fun build_and_recv_msg/0,
 2771:             fun bif_and_recv_timeout/0,
 2772:             fun bif_and_recv_msg/0
 2773:            ],
 2774:     _ = [begin
 2775:              {Pid,Ref} = spawn_opt(F, [{max_heap_size,
 2776:                                         #{size => 233, kill => true,
 2777:                                           error_logger => false}},
 2778:                                        monitor]),
 2779:              io:format("~p ~p\n", [Pid,F]),
 2780:              receive
 2781:                  {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,Reason} ->
 2782:                      killed = Reason
 2783:              end
 2784:          end || F <- Funs],
 2785:     ok.
 2786: 
 2787: %% This number should be greater than the default heap size.
 2788: -define(MANY_ITERATIONS, 10_000).
 2789: 
 2790: build_and_bif() ->
 2791:     build_and_bif(?MANY_ITERATIONS, []).
 2792: 
 2793: build_and_bif(0, Acc0) ->
 2794:     Acc0;
 2795: build_and_bif(N, Acc0) ->
 2796:     Acc = [0|Acc0],
 2797:     _ = erlang:crc32(Acc),
 2798:     build_and_bif(N-1, Acc).
 2799: 
 2800: build_bin_and_bif() ->
 2801:     build_bin_and_bif(?MANY_ITERATIONS, <<>>).
 2802: 
 2803: build_bin_and_bif(0, Acc0) ->
 2804:     Acc0;
 2805: build_bin_and_bif(N, Acc0) ->
 2806:     Acc = <<0, Acc0/binary>>,
 2807:     _ = erlang:crc32(Acc),
 2808:     build_bin_and_bif(N-1, Acc).
 2809: 
 2810: build_and_recv_timeout() ->
 2811:     build_and_recv_timeout(?MANY_ITERATIONS, []).
 2812: 
 2813: build_and_recv_timeout(0, Acc0) ->
 2814:     Acc0;
 2815: build_and_recv_timeout(N, Acc0) ->
 2816:     Acc = [0|Acc0],
 2817:     receive
 2818:     after 1 ->
 2819:             ok
 2820:     end,
 2821:     build_and_recv_timeout(N-1, Acc).
 2822: 
 2823: build_and_recv_msg() ->
 2824:     build_and_recv_msg(?MANY_ITERATIONS, []).
 2825: 
 2826: build_and_recv_msg(0, Acc0) ->
 2827:     Acc0;
 2828: build_and_recv_msg(N, Acc0) ->
 2829:     Acc = [0|Acc0],
 2830:     receive
 2831:         _ ->
 2832:             ok
 2833:     after 0 ->
 2834:             ok
 2835:     end,
 2836:     build_and_recv_msg(N-1, Acc).
 2837: 
 2838: bif_and_recv_timeout() ->
 2839:     Bin = <<0:?MANY_ITERATIONS/unit:8>>,
 2840:     bif_and_recv_timeout(Bin).
 2841: 
 2842: bif_and_recv_timeout(Bin) ->
 2843:     List = binary_to_list(Bin),
 2844:     receive
 2845:     after 1 ->
 2846:             ok
 2847:     end,
 2848:     List.
 2849: 
 2850: bif_and_recv_msg() ->
 2851:     Bin = <<0:?MANY_ITERATIONS/unit:8>>,
 2852:     bif_and_recv_msg(Bin).
 2853: 
 2854: bif_and_recv_msg(Bin) ->
 2855:     List = binary_to_list(Bin),
 2856:     receive
 2857:         _ ->
 2858:             ok
 2859:     after 0 ->
 2860:             ok
 2861:     end,
 2862:     List.
 2863: 
 2864: %% error_logger report handler proxy
 2865: init(Pid) ->
 2866:     {ok, Pid}.
 2867: 
 2868: handle_event(Event, Pid) ->
 2869:     Pid ! Event,
 2870:     {ok, Pid}.
 2871:
